channel.title: My Server Wont Work[I've Used The Tutorial]
channel.description:
Ok i've tried everything possible to make my server work and it just wont!
Ok i have JDK6u23 and i've updated my Environment Variables to this: CLASSPATH:[CODE]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/CODE] PATH:[CODE]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin[/CODE]
I did make a no-ip and and it is my ".no-ip.org" is checked on the No-Ip DUC.
I also have a Source and Client. My server will work on IP 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 but thats useless!
Now Port Forwarding was the hardest part, idk if i did it right or not! I have a 2Wire 2701HG-B Router. Its from att&t! I Will Post a Picture on what mine looks like! [URL=http://img441.imageshack.us/i/65745743765475675.jpg/][IMG]http://img441.imageshack.us/img441/6595/65745743765475675.jpg[/img][/URL]
Uploaded with [URL=http://imageshack.us]ImageShack.us[/URL]
I can do team viewer if someone is willing to help me and i will return the favor! PLEASE IDK WHAT THE HELL TO DO!

item.title: My Server Wont Work[I've Used The Tutorial]
item.dc:creator: @GoranTheSerb GoranTheSerb
item.description:
@GoranTheSerb wrote:

[quote=“Tribey, post:14, topic:373175”][quote author=GoranTheSerb link=topic=469191.msg3430324#msg3430324 date=1292281946]

Port forwarding is your prime suspect. If all else fails, contact your ISP, and ask them whether port forwarding is actually available. As my current internet has port forwarding options, but it isn’t actually available/working.

HUH?

How do i check?
Basically in simple terms, what I’m saying is your “internet” may not even support port forwarding. Even if the options are there, it may not work.

[/quote]

If it comes to it, you can email or/and phone up your ISP. But that’s only last resorts.[/quote]

Can you try to help me through Teamviewer?

Read full topic
item.source: My Server Wont Work[I've Used The Tutorial]

If it comes to it, you can email or/and phone up your ISP. But that’s only last resorts.

[quote=“GoranTheSerb, post:11, topic:373175”][quote author=Tribey link=topic=469191.msg3430309#msg3430309 date=1292281336]
Port forwarding is your prime suspect. If all else fails, contact your ISP, and ask them whether port forwarding is actually available. As my current internet has port forwarding options, but it isn’t actually available/working.
[/quote]
HUH?[/quote]

Basically in simple terms, what I’m saying is your “internet” may not even support port forwarding. Even if the options are there, it may not work.

item.title: My Server Wont Work[I've Used The Tutorial]
item.dc:creator: @GoranTheSerb GoranTheSerb
item.description:
@GoranTheSerb wrote:

Gives me this every time

Error: I could not see your service on “MY IP” on port (43594)
Reason: Connection timed out

EDIT: Ok but i went to “http://www.yougetsignal.com/tools/open-ports/”
And it Said “Port 43594 is closed on MY IP.”
HOW DO I FIX?

Read full topic

item.description:
@GoranTheSerb wrote:

Ok i’ve tried everything possible to make my server work and it just wont!

Ok i have JDK6u23 and i’ve updated my Environment Variables to this:
CLASSPATH:CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
PATH:C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_23\bin

I did make a no-ip and and it is my “.no-ip.org” is checked on the No-Ip DUC.

I also have a Source and Client. My server will work on IP 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 but thats useless!

Now Port Forwarding was the hardest part, idk if i did it right or not! I have a 2Wire 2701HG-B Router. Its from att&t! I Will Post a Picture on what mine looks like!

Uploaded with ImageShack.us

I can do team viewer if someone is willing to help me and i will return the favor! PLEASE IDK WHAT THE HELL TO DO!
